comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message prompting users to log in to continue the login process. It appears on a login form and is displayed when the user has confirmed their email address but hasn't completed the login process yet.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Bitte einloggen' is a literal translation but doesn't convey the natural meaning of 'Log in to continue'. A more appropriate translation would emphasize the continuation aspect.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bitte melden Sie sich an, um fortzufahren

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Շարունակելու համար մուտք գործեք' is a literal translation of 'Log in to continue' but sounds less natural in Armenian. A more idiomatic translation would be something like 'Մուտքագրվելու համար շարունակեք' or 'Մուտքագրվեք շարունակելու համար'.

The Lao translation 'ເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບ ເພື່ອດຳເນີນການຕໍ່' is a literal translation of 'Log in to continue' but doesn't convey the intended meaning as naturally as it could. 'ເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບ' is correct for 'Log in,' but 'ເພື່ອກຳເນີນການຕໍ່' is a bit formal and less common for a button label urging the user to proceed. A more natural phrasing would be more direct.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ເຂົ້າສູ່ລະບົບຕໍ່ໄປ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation includes a space between words which is standard for Lao, but it's worth confirming this is how it will be displayed in the UI. Sometimes UI frameworks can affect spacing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: N/A - Confirm spacing in UI context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Romanian translation 'Trebuie să vă conectați cu contul pentru a continua' is too literal and verbose for the English phrase 'Log in to continue'. It translates to 'You need to connect with the account to continue'.
The Romanian translation includes 'cu contul' (with the account) which is unnecessary and makes the phrasing awkward.

The Russian translation "Пожалуйста, авторизуйтесь" translates to "Please authorize yourself." While not technically incorrect, it doesn't convey the meaning of "Log in to continue" as effectively. "Log in" is a specific action, while "authorize" is a broader concept. A more appropriate translation would be something like "Войдите, чтобы продолжить" or "Авторизуйтесь для продолжения".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider "Войдите, чтобы продолжить" or "Авторизуйтесь для продолжения".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'ඉදිරියට යාමට පිවිසෙන්න' while understandable, is not the most natural or direct translation of 'Log in to continue'. It literally translates to 'Enter to go forward'. A more accurate and common translation would be something like 'ඇතුළත්වන්න' or 'පහසුවෙන් පිවිසෙන්න'.
